column1: A 1954 Resolution of the Council of Ministers of 13 November approved the proposal of the Main Directorate of the Civil Air Fleet under the Council of Ministers of the USSR on the construction of the second airport of the Moscow civil air fleet near the village Elgazin Podolsky (now Domodedovo) Moscow Oblast.

column2: a decree of the USSR Council of Ministers enabled completion of construction of the first stage of the airport in 1962.
an Order of the Head of Main Directorate of Civil Aviation
column3: issued on 7 April No. 200 ("On the organization of the Moscow Domodedovo airport") ordered "organize as part of the Moscow Transport Aviation Management Directorate the new airport
column4: and continue to call it the Moscow Domodedovo Airport". Therefore
column5: 7 April 1962 is considered the official birthday of the airport. By the end of 1962
column7: the airport began flights by postal and cargo planes.

column1: Services from Domodedovo began in March 1964 with a flight to Sverdlovsk using a Tupolev 104. The airport
column2: intended to handle the growth of long-distance domestic traffic in the Soviet Union
column3: was officially opened in May 1965. A second runway
column5: was put into service 18 months after the opening of the airport. On 26 December 1975
column6: Domodedovo Airport was selected for the inaugural flight of the Tupolev Tu-144 to Alma Ata.

column2: the airport began an expansion program designed to obtain approval for wide-body aircraft operations. The runway
column3: taxiways
column4: and parking areas were enlarged and strengthened. In March 2009
column5: it was announced that the approval had been granted
column6: making Domodedovo Airport the first in Russia approved for new large aircraft (NLA) operations such as the Airbus A380. The approval signifies that its operations areas comply with size and strength requirements of ICAO Category F standards. The airport has ILS category III A status.

column1: Domodedovo Airport has been the focus of two terrorist-related incidents. In 2004
column2: Muslim suicide bombers managed to pass airport security
column3: board two passenger planes
column4: and carry out the bombings after departure from Domodedovo. Despite the heightened security measures taken after this incident
column5: another suicide bomber attack occurred on 24 January 2011
column6: when an Islamist militant entered the terminal building and detonated a bomb in the arrival hall. As a result
column7: mandatory screening and pat-down practices have been introduced at the airport terminal entrances.

column1: Domodedovo Airport has one terminal building comprising two separate concourses for domestic (and some former Soviet republic countries) and international flights. It has 22 jetways altogether. When Terminal 2 is completed
column2: the number of jet bridges will rise to 33.

column1: Both concourses A and B contain Duty Free facilities
column2: with a wider selection at concourse A
column3: because of the international destinations served there. At concourse B the selection is narrower
column4: because of the domestic destinations. The duty-free selection will be expanded after Terminal 2 commences operations. The contract for operating at the duty-free shops in Terminal 2 was won by Heinemann Duty Free.

column2: a new hotel was opened inside the airport terminal ("Aerotel Express"). This allows passengers transiting through Moscow to stay at a hotel without exiting the terminal (previously transit passengers had to leave the terminal and use a shuttle van to access the nearest hotel). This was the first hotel inside an airport terminal in Russia.

column7: the Priority Pass Business Lounge and several more. Most of the Lounges can also be accessed with a Star Alliance Gold Member Card (or higher) or a Oneworld Emerald Card (or higher).

column2: the OneWorld Alliance confirmed their plans of opening their first branded lounge relating to their 20th anniversary at Moscow's Domodedovo International Airport. Further details on the lounge and its opening date will be announced in 2020.
